questions.text: A middle-aged driver has come to the ophthalmology OPD for his medical check-up. Which of the following tests cannot assess whether the patient has color blindness?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Pelli Robson Charts Pelli Robson Charts are used for testing Contrast Sensitivity . Functional Acuity Contrast Tests and Cambridge contrast sensitivity tests are some of the other examples. It measures contrast sensitivity using a single large letter size (20/60 optotype) with contrast varying across groups of letters(6 per line ) arranged in groups whose contrast varies from high to low. Patients read the letters, starting with the highest contrast , until they can read two or three letters in a single group.

Highyeild:

A score of less than 1.5 is consistent with visual impairment , with a score of less than 1.0 representing visual disability.

questions.text: The Following Test was performed on a patient in the Department. Which of the following statements regarding the following Test is not true?

options.label: A
options.text: To evaluate Horizontal Ocular Deviations, the bars on the Maddox rod are aligned horizontally

options.label: B
options.text: If there is no deviation, the red line is perceived as passing through the white light

options.label: C
options.text: Esodeviated eyes would result in the red line appearing to the left of the white light

options.label: D
options.text: A binocular Patient's covered eye sees the red line while the uncovered eye perceives the white light

questions.correct_answer: C. Esodeviated eyes would result in the red line appearing to the left of the white light
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Esodeviated eyes would result in the red line appearing to the left of the white light Exo Deviated eyes would result in the red line appearing to the left of the white light , while Esodeviated eyes would result in the red line appearing to the right. If the eyes are eso deviate d, the red line, whose image falls abnormally on the nasal side of the retina and is perceived to the right of the white light. Exo Deviated eyes would result in the red line appearing to the left of the light because the red image would fall on the temporal side of the retina.

Highyeild:

Maddox rod testing is done for ocular misalignment . The Maddox rod is usually placed over the right eye, and the person is asked to fixate on the white light.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option:A. The bars are aligned horizontally to evaluate horizontal deviations so that the patient sees a vertical red line with the right eye. Option:B. If there is no horizontal deviation , the patient perceives the red line passing through the white light Option:D. A binocular patient’s right eye sees a red line, while the uncovered left eye perceives the white light

Extraedge:

For evaluating vertical deviations , the bars on the Maddox rod should be structured vertically so that the horizontal red line is seen with the right eye. The red line passes through the white light without vertical deviation . A red line below the white light indicates a right hyper deviation, while a white light below the red line implies a left hyper deviation.

questions.explanation:
Solution:

1 - No Vertical deviation, 2- No Horizontal deviation, 3 - Esodeviation, 4- Right Hyperdeviation 1 - No Vertical deviation, 2- No Horizontal deviation, 3 - Esodeviation, 4- Right Hyperdeviation Maddox rod testing is done for ocular misalignment . The Maddox rod is usually placed over the right eye, and the person is asked to fixate on the white light. A binocular patient’s right eye sees a red line, while the uncovered left eye perceives the white light . The bars are aligned horizontally to evaluate horizontal deviations so that the patient sees a vertical red line with the right eye. If there is no horizontal deviation , the patient perceives the red line passing through the white light.

The red line passes through the white light without vertical deviation . A red line below the white light indicates a right hyper deviation, while a white light below the red line implies a left hyper deviation

questions.text: A patient with features of Macular Edema is advised to undergo Optical Coherence Tomography in the Department for the diagnosis and further management of the same. All of the following statements regarding OCT are true EXCEPT.

options.label: A
options.text: OCT provides cross-sectional or three-dimensional images of the Optic nerve head In Vivo.

options.label: B
options.text: Individual tissues are identified, thickness measured, abnormalities detected, and can be compared over time.

options.label: C
options.text: OCT uses optical backscattering of the light to image parts like the retina and the Anterior segment of the eye.

options.label: D
options.text: It is used to diagnose macular oedema, subretinal fluid But not retinal pigment epithelial irregularity.

questions.correct_answer: D. It is used to diagnose macular oedema, subretinal fluid But not retinal pigment epithelial irregularity.
questions.explanation:
Solution:

It is used to diagnose macular oedema, subretinal fluid But not retinal pigment epithelial irregularity. Optical Coherence Tomography diagnoses macular oedema or macular traction , subretinal fluid , and ALSO retinal pigment epithelial irregularities .

Highyeild:

It can also be used to monitor therapy over the time

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option:A. It provides cross-sectional or 3D images of these tissues in vivo, like an ultrasound image Option:B . Individual tissues can be identified, thickness measured, abnormalities detected, and are compared over time. Option:C. Optical coherence tomography usually uses optical backscattering of light to image tissues like the Retina, Optic nerve head, and Anterior eye segment with a resolution of as low as seven μm.
